Stock

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<Item,java.lang.Integer>
        • Stock.Stock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<Item,java.lang.Integer>

    public class Stock
extends java.util.HashMap<Item,java.lang.Integer>
    Stock extends HashMap. This is used so that stock can use the collection type and method contained within HashMap. This will allow the storage of Items and their associated quantities. Stock stores Item's and there associated quantities. This allows a reorder method to developed to see what needs to be sent to manifest to be reordered
    Author:
    Matthew Topping
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stock

        public Stock()

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        public void initialise(Item item)
                throws NoItemDuplicatesException
        This method is used to enter an item into the stock collection for the first time. Once this is done the other methods will be able to be used on the item to manipulate it's associated qualities
        Parameters:
        item - the Item that is stored in the inventory
        quantity - the amount of the item that is currently in the inventory
        Throws:
        NoItemDuplicatesException - to avoid having quantity stores in multiple locations an item will not be able to be added twice in stock. This exception is thrown if this is attempted

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String itemName,
                int quantity)
         throws ItemDoesNotExistException
        This method is used to increase the quantity of an item held in the stock.
        Parameters:
        itemName - the String name of the item that's quantity wants to be increased
        quantity - the amount that the quantity is to be increased by
        Throws:
        ItemDoesNotExistException - this is thrown if the item searched for does not exist in the stock

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String itemName,
                   int quantity)
            throws ItemDoesNotExistException
        This method is used to decrease the quantity of an item within the stock
        Parameters:
        itemName - the String name of the item that's quantity wants to be decreased
        quantity - the amount that the quantity is to be decreased by
        Throws:
        ItemDoesNotExistException - this is thrown if the item searched for does not exist in the stock

      • currentQuantity

        public int currentQuantity(java.lang.String item)
                    throws ItemDoesNotExistException
        This method allows a search for an item to see it's current quantity within the stock
        Parameters:
        item - the String name of the item that is having it's quantity retrieved
        Returns:
        the current quantity stored of the item searched for
        Throws:
        ItemDoesNotExistException - this is thrown if the item searched for does not exist in the stock

      • discontinue

        public void discontinue(java.lang.String item)
                 throws ItemDoesNotExistException
        This method will remove an item from the stock. This will also remove it's associated quantity
        Parameters:
        item - the String name of the item that wants to removed from the stock
        Throws:
        ItemDoesNotExistException - this is thrown if the item searched for does not exist in the stock

      • itemRetriever

        public Item itemRetriever(java.lang.String itemName)
                   throws ItemDoesNotExistException
        This method retrieves the Item object from a string search. This will then allow the internal information of an item to be used as it will be return.
        Parameters:
        itemName - the String name of the item that is being fetched
        Returns:
        Item returns the item that was search for by ut's string name
        Throws:
        ItemDoesNotExistException - this is thrown if the item searched for does not exist in the stock

      • reorder

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> reorder()
                                  throws ItemDoesNotExistException
        This method searches the current inventory and works out whether there are any quantities that are below the reorder point for that associated item. If there are item's that fit this requirement, then they are added to a list which is returned. This can then be used by other classes such as Manifest to produce a work order
        Returns:
        ArrayList returns a list of items that need reordering
        Throws:
        ItemDoesNotExistException - this is thrown if the item searched for does not exist in the stock. Note that this is unlikely in this method however as it can be thrown by other methods used where user input can occur it is required
